revised_title: The 1971 Eruption of Mount Etna: A Comprehensive Overview
tldr: The 1971 eruption of Mount Etna was a significant event that lasted 69 days and resulted in the formation of lava fields covering 7.5 square kilometers. The eruption had two distinct phases, with lava issuing from fissure vents situated up to 5 km from the summit. The eruption caused damage to infrastructure, destroyed buildings, and covered farmland with lava. The central crater of Etna was inactive during the eruption, but activity resumed in September 1971.
